value: Jadraas banner Mallet locomotive DONJ no 12.jpg

With only 6,000 inhabitants Ockelbo is the smallest municipality in Gästrikland, this is rural Sweden with lots of forest and small farms. Outlying villages in the municipality includes

. Many here commute to work in the larger city of Gävle, just 30 minutes to the south but a spirit of entrepreneurship rests above the town and there are several small innovative companies. The town is also known as the home of Daniel Westling, now married to Crown Princess Victoria.
about once an hour during the day, from the other direction trains arrive from

.

To get here by car, take the highway E4 north and turn off to road 303. An other option is to take road 272 from
. Speed limits along the smaller roads is 70 km/h for most of the time, however the routes are quite scenic.
Ockelbo is very small, so seeing the town by foot is a good option. To get around the municipality just hop on one of the free
, the timetables are not perfect but they will take you to almost all the small outlying communities.

value: content=A century old steel mill now converted into a living garden. Don't miss the Rose Garden with 230 different sorts of roses. It's also a regional center for the education of gardeners.
content=Serves a daily lunch buffet during summer made from local produce. Other seasons open only when pre-booked.
content=Located just south of the towns center, simpler rooms but in a charming old villa.
content=Small hostel, only 24 beds, located at the main square.
